item.title: Match to lay off 13% of staff
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: Dating app giant Match Group is laying off 13% of its staff as part of a reorganization that aims to reduce costs and simplify its organizational structure.

item.title: Amazon’s newest AI tool is designed to enhance product listings
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Amazon said Thursday it is releasing a new generative AI-powered tool to help merchants improve their listings with missing details or attributes. Sellers often have hundreds of products listed on Amazon, and they need to update information related to them from time to time, which can be a cumbersome task. The e-commerce tech giant wants […]

item.title: Reddit intros new profile tools for its business customers
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Reddit on Thursday announced profile enhancements for businesses that use Reddit Pro, the company’s suite of tools designed to help brands discover, join and contribute to the social network’s communities and conversations. Reddit will now generate and suggest profile bios for businesses when they sign up for Reddit Pro. Once businesses provide their website, they […]

item.title: Asking chatbots for short answers can increase hallucinations, study finds
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Turns out, telling an AI chatbot to be concise could make it hallucinate more than it otherwise would have. That’s according to a new study from Giskard, a Paris-based AI testing company developing a holistic benchmark for AI models. In a blog post detailing their findings, researchers at Giskard say prompts for shorter answers to […]

item.title: VC firm Insight Partners confirms personal data stolen during January hack
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The venture capital firm has over $90 billion in assets under management, including cybersecurity giants.

item.title: Why Hims & Hers turned to the autonomous vehicle industry to find an AI-savvy CTO
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Hims & Hers, the telehealth and wellness company, has hired a veteran of the autonomous vehicle industry as its next chief technology officer. The move, according to Hims & Hers co-founder and CEO, Andrew Dudum, was intentional. Hims & Hers on Thursday said its next CTO would be Mo Elshenawy, the former president and CTO […]

item.title: Apple tries to delay ruling that bars it from taking a cut on external app payments
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta, Ram Iyer
item.description: Apple is trying to delay a court ruling that forces the company to let iOS app developers accept payments via non-Apple systems and avoid paying a cut.

item.title: Bosch Ventures is turning its attention to North America with new $270M fund
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The venture arm of Bosch has a new $270 million fund that will continue its tradition of investing in deep-tech startups. This time, however, Bosch Ventures plans to put more of its money into North American startups. Launched in 2007, Bosch Ventures is now on its sixth fund. And while the corporate VC is technically […]

item.title: Instacart CEO Fidji Simo is joining OpenAI
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Simo, already a board member at OpenAI, will transition out of Instacart over the next few months and join the AI company full-time as Application CEO.

item.title: Fastino trains AI models on cheap gaming GPUs and just raised $17.5M led by Khosla
item.dc:creator: Charles Rollet
item.description: Tech giants like to boast about trillion-parameter AI models that require massive and expensive GPU clusters. But Fastino is taking a different approach. The Palo Alto-based startup says it has invented a new kind of AI model architecture that’s intentionally small and task-specific. The models are so small they’re trained with low-end gaming GPUs worth […]

item.title: Stripe unveils AI foundation model for payments, reveals ‘deeper partnership’ with Nvidia
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description: Fintech giant Stripe announced Wednesday a slew of new product launches at its annual Stripe Sessions user event. The highlights include a new AI foundation model for payments; stablecoin-powered accounts; a new Orchestration offering, and a recent migration with chip behemoth Nvidia. Stripe’s payments foundation model has been trained on tens of billions of transactions, […]

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs
item.dc:creator: Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer, Kate Park
item.description: A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2024.

item.title: Tesla’s ‘Robotaxi’ and ‘Cybercab’ trademarks hit roadblocks ahead of June launch
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Tesla’s attempt to trademark the term “Robotaxi” in reference to its vehicles has been refused by the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office for being too generic, according to a new filing. Another application by Tesla to trademark the term “Robotaxi” for its upcoming ride-hailing service is still under examination by the office. In addition, applications […]

item.title: OpenAI and the FDA are reportedly discussing AI for drug evaluations
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: OpenAI has met with officials from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to discuss the agency’s use of AI to speed up drug evaluations, Wired reported on Wednesday. According to the report, OpenAI and the FDA have discussed a project called cderGPT, which seems to be an AI tool for the Center for Drug […]

item.title: The Papal ‘conclave cam’ is slow TV
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: On YouTube, hundreds of thousands of viewers around the world are staring at an unmoving broadcast of the Sistine Chapel chimney. Occasionally, a seagull will swoop in and perch atop the roof for a few minutes. But for the most part, nothing happens. On Wednesday, the College of Cardinals started the process of picking the […]

item.title: Delta’s game emulator becomes a Patreon-supported app after US App Store policy changes
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: A game emulator called Delta is taking advantage of the recent court decision around Apple’s App Store to support its business by linking to its Patreon membership page. The update, approved Wednesday for release on the U.S. App Store, allows Delta users to join the Delta team’s Patreon directly from the mobile app, without giving […]

item.title: Rove, founded by a 22-year-old, is helping Gen Z earn airline miles without credit cards
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: During his junior year study abroad, Max Morganroth, traveled to 30 countries, primarily flying in business and first class. His jet-setting was funded almost entirely by airline points he collected through strategic credit card applications and miles redemptions. Morganroth told TechCrunch that just about everyone he knew was “begging” him to teach them how to […]

item.title: Anthropic rolls out an API for AI-powered web search
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Anthropic is launching a new API that allows its Claude AI models to search across the web. Developers using it can build Claude-powered apps that deliver up-to-date info, the company said in a press release published Wednesday. The rollout of the API comes as AI companies look to augment their models in various ways that […]

item.title: Snap Map reaches new milestone of 400M monthly active users
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Snapchat announced on Wednesday that Snap Map now has more than 400 million monthly active users, a new milestone for one of the app’s core features. Launched in 2017, Snap Map was originally a way for users to see their friends’ locations and browse public snaps from around the world. Over time, the feature has […]

item.title: Lucid Motors’ Gravity SUV dealing with early ‘hiccups,’ interim CEO says
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Lucid Motors has been working through some quality “hiccups” in the early stages of delivering its long-awaited electric SUV, according to interim CEO Marc Winterhoff. “It is true that we had some technical issues that we had to overcome around software” and the Gravity’s heads-up display, Winterhoff said on a conference call Tuesday. “There have […]
